list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Refactor: Centralize Android build conventions with a new plugin
This commit introduces a major refactoring of the Gradle build configuration to centralize Android-specific settings into a new convention plugin.
Key changes: - **New Convention Plugin:** Added `AurakaiAndroidConventionPlugin` in `build-logic` to manage common Android configurations (SDK versions, Proguard, compile options, etc.). - **Plugin Application:** Android modules (`app`, `benchmark`, `feature-module`, `romtools`, `sandbox-ui`) now apply the new `dev.aurakai.aurakai-android-convention` plugin, removing redundant local configurations. - **Root `build.gradle.kts` Refactor:** - Cleaned up and reorganized the root build script, removing many deprecated tasks (`projectInfo`, `clean`, etc.) and moving logic into more appropriate locations. - Updated and restyled the `consciousnessStatus` and `consciousnessHealthCheck` tasks for better readability. - Centralized JVM and Java toolchain configuration for all subprojects. - **Dependency & Plugin Updates:** - Upgraded Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) from `9.0.0-alpha02` to `9.0.0-alpha09`. - Consolidated Kotlin and AGP plugin versions in `settings.gradle.kts` to ensure consistency. - Removed the obsolete `scripts/apply-yukihook-conventions.gradle.kts` script. - **Code Cleanup:** - Removed now-unnecessary `kotlin("jvm")` and `kotlin { jvmToolchain(...) }` blocks from various module `build.gradle.kts` files as this is now handled globally. - Specified `composeOptions` with a hardcoded Kotlin compiler extension version in modules that use Compose.

Refactor CanvasScreen KDoc
The KDoc for the `CanvasScreen` composable was simplified to improve readability and conciseness. Removed redundant descriptions and focused on the core features and behaviors.

Migrate to AGP 9.0.0-alpha08 and new Variant API for generated sources
- Update Android Gradle Plugin to version 9.0.0-alpha08 - Add `android.builtInKotlin=false` and `android.newDsl=false` to `gradle.properties` as required by AGP 9.0.0+ - Remove deprecated `sourceSets` configuration for generated OpenAPI sources - Register generated OpenAPI sources using the new Android Components Variant API - This change ensures compatibility with the latest AGP and adopts the recommended approach for managing generated source directories.

Migrate to AGP 9.0.0-alpha08 and new Variant API for generated sources
- Update Android Gradle Plugin to version 9.0.0-alpha08 - Add `android.builtInKotlin=false` and `android.newDsl=false` to `gradle.properties` as required by AGP 9.0.0+ - Remove deprecated `sourceSets` configuration for generated OpenAPI sources - Register generated OpenAPI sources using the new Android Components Variant API - This change ensures compatibility with the latest AGP and adopts the recommended approach for managing generated source directories.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/OVERDRIVE' into OVERDRIVE

Refactor: Streamline Kotlin Android plugin application and re-enable romtools
- Remove explicit `org.jetbrains.kotlin.android` plugin application from various modules as it's handled by convention plugins. - Re-enable the `romtools` module in `settings.gradle.kts` and `app/build.gradle.kts`. - Enable Room KSP compiler in `romtools/build.gradle.kts`. - Update OpenAPI generator plugin version in `app/build.gradle.kts`. - Correct Java home path in `gradle.properties`. - Minor plugin alias changes in `app/build.gradle.kts`.

Refactor: Streamline Kotlin Android plugin application and re-enable romtools
- Remove explicit `org.jetbrains.kotlin.android` plugin application from various modules as it's handled by convention plugins. - Re-enable the `romtools` module in `settings.gradle.kts` and `app/build.gradle.kts`. - Enable Room KSP compiler in `romtools/build.gradle.kts`. - Update OpenAPI generator plugin version in `app/build.gradle.kts`. - Correct Java home path in `gradle.properties`. - Minor plugin alias changes in `app/build.gradle.kts`.

Refactor: Streamline Kotlin Android plugin application and re-enable romtools
- Remove explicit `org.jetbrains.kotlin.android` plugin application from various modules as it's handled by convention plugins. - Re-enable the `romtools` module in `settings.gradle.kts` and `app/build.gradle.kts`. - Enable Room KSP compiler in `romtools/build.gradle.kts`. - Update OpenAPI generator plugin version in `app/build.gradle.kts`. - Correct Java home path in `gradle.properties`. - Minor plugin alias changes in `app/build.gradle.kts`.

Refactor: Improve build configuration and add developer warnings
- Add `.gitattributes` to enforce consistent LF line endings. - Update `README.md` with a warning about editing generated code. - Refactor `app/build.gradle.kts` to correctly wire the OpenAPI generated source directory. - Increase Gradle JVM memory arguments from 8192m to 10000m in `app/gradle.properties`.

Refactor: Consolidate CI workflows and introduce OpenAPI generation
This commit streamlines the project's structure by refactoring CI/CD workflows and introducing a formal OpenAPI specification for API client generation.
- **CI/CD Workflow Consolidation:** - Deletes multiple old and redundant GitHub Actions workflow files (`ci-build.yml`, `genesis-ci.yml`, `consciousness-monitoring.yml`, `performance-monitoring.yml`, `TEST2.yml`). - Replaces them with new, placeholder workflows in the `.github/workflows/` directory for CI builds, performance, and consciousness monitoring. - Simplifies the `dependabot.yml` configuration.
- **OpenAPI and API Generation:** - Introduces a new `data:api` module dedicated to generating an API client from an OpenAPI specification (`unified-deliverance-api.yml`). - Adds new OpenAPI specification files (`unified-deliverance-api.yml`, `auraframefx-api-spec.yaml`) to define the API contracts. - Removes the old `openApiGenerate` configuration from the `app/build.gradle.kts` file. - Adds a dependency from the `app` module to the new `:data:api` module.
- **Project Documentation & Cleanup:** - Adds `ProjectRefactorPlan.md` detailing the strategy for refactoring APIs and unifying the customization engine. - Removes the `qodana.yaml` static analysis configuration file. - Deletes unused `main.yml` and `dependabot.yml` from the root directory.
- **Build Configuration:** - Updates `settings.gradle.kts` to include the new `:data:api` module. - Minor cleanup in `build-logic/build.gradle.kts` and `benchmark/build.gradle.kts`.
Refactor: Update Gradle properties and improve OpenAPI generation configuration

feat: Enable core library desugaring
Enables core library desugaring in the `compileOptions` to allow the use of newer Java language features on older Android versions.

feat: Enable core library desugaring
Enables core library desugaring in the `compileOptions` to allow the use of newer Java language features on older Android versions.

Refactor: Centralize Android build conventions with a new plugin
This commit introduces a major refactoring of the Gradle build configuration to centralize Android-specific settings into a new convention plugin.
Key changes: - **New Convention Plugin:** Added `AurakaiAndroidConventionPlugin` in `build-logic` to manage common Android configurations (SDK versions, Proguard, compile options, etc.). - **Plugin Application:** Android modules (`app`, `benchmark`, `feature-module`, `romtools`, `sandbox-ui`) now apply the new `dev.aurakai.aurakai-android-convention` plugin, removing redundant local configurations. - **Root `build.gradle.kts` Refactor:** - Cleaned up and reorganized the root build script, removing many deprecated tasks (`projectInfo`, `clean`, etc.) and moving logic into more appropriate locations. - Updated and restyled the `consciousnessStatus` and `consciousnessHealthCheck` tasks for better readability. - Centralized JVM and Java toolchain configuration for all subprojects. - **Dependency & Plugin Updates:** - Upgraded Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) from `9.0.0-alpha02` to `9.0.0-alpha09`. - Consolidated Kotlin and AGP plugin versions in `settings.gradle.kts` to ensure consistency. - Removed the obsolete `scripts/apply-yukihook-conventions.gradle.kts` script. - **Code Cleanup:** - Removed now-unnecessary `kotlin("jvm")` and `kotlin { jvmToolchain(...) }` blocks from various module `build.gradle.kts` files as this is now handled globally. - Specified `composeOptions` with a hardcoded Kotlin compiler extension version in modules that use Compose.

Refactor: Streamline Kotlin Android plugin application and re-enable romtools
- Remove explicit `org.jetbrains.kotlin.android` plugin application from various modules as it's handled by convention plugins. - Re-enable the `romtools` module in `settings.gradle.kts` and `app/build.gradle.kts`. - Enable Room KSP compiler in `romtools/build.gradle.kts`. - Update OpenAPI generator plugin version in `app/build.gradle.kts`. - Correct Java home path in `gradle.properties`. - Minor plugin alias changes in `app/build.gradle.kts`.

Refactor: Improve build configuration and add developer warnings
- Add `.gitattributes` to enforce consistent LF line endings. - Update `README.md` with a warning about editing generated code. - Refactor `app/build.gradle.kts` to correctly wire the OpenAPI generated source directory. - Increase Gradle JVM memory arguments from 8192m to 10000m in `app/gradle.properties`.

Refactor: Consolidate CI workflows and introduce OpenAPI generation
This commit streamlines the project's structure by refactoring CI/CD workflows and introducing a formal OpenAPI specification for API client generation.
- **CI/CD Workflow Consolidation:** - Deletes multiple old and redundant GitHub Actions workflow files (`ci-build.yml`, `genesis-ci.yml`, `consciousness-monitoring.yml`, `performance-monitoring.yml`, `TEST2.yml`). - Replaces them with new, placeholder workflows in the `.github/workflows/` directory for CI builds, performance, and consciousness monitoring. - Simplifies the `dependabot.yml` configuration.
- **OpenAPI and API Generation:** - Introduces a new `data:api` module dedicated to generating an API client from an OpenAPI specification (`unified-deliverance-api.yml`). - Adds new OpenAPI specification files (`unified-deliverance-api.yml`, `auraframefx-api-spec.yaml`) to define the API contracts. - Removes the old `openApiGenerate` configuration from the `app/build.gradle.kts` file. - Adds a dependency from the `app` module to the new `:data:api` module.
- **Project Documentation & Cleanup:** - Adds `ProjectRefactorPlan.md` detailing the strategy for refactoring APIs and unifying the customization engine. - Removes the `qodana.yaml` static analysis configuration file. - Deletes unused `main.yml` and `dependabot.yml` from the root directory.
- **Build Configuration:** - Updates `settings.gradle.kts` to include the new `:data:api` module. - Minor cleanup in `build-logic/build.gradle.kts` and `benchmark/build.gradle.kts`.

Refactor: Streamline OpenAPI generator configuration
- Remove redundant `dependsOn` configurations for `openApiGenerate` in the `app` module. - Update `data/api` build script to use modern source set configuration. - Correct the OpenAPI specification filename from `my-api-spec.yaml` to `unified-deliverance-api.yml`. - Set `validateSpec` to `false` and fix `serializationLibrary` value to `kotlinx_serialization`. - Remove an unnecessary comment from `gradle.properties`.

feat: Enable core library desugaring
Enables core library desugaring in the `compileOptions` to allow the use of newer Java language features on older Android versions.

Refactor: Centralize Android build logic with a convention plugin
This commit introduces the `dev.aurakai.aurakai-android-convention` Gradle plugin to centralize Android build configurations, replacing the `apply-yukihook-conventions.gradle.kts` script.
Key changes: - Created `AurakaiAndroidConventionPlugin` in `build-logic` to manage common Android settings like `compileSdk`, `minSdk`, `targetSdk`, and `jvmTarget`. - Upgraded the Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) to `9.0.0-alpha09`. - Applied the new convention plugin to Android modules (`app`, `feature-module`, `sandbox-ui`, `romtools`, `benchmark`). - Removed redundant `kotlin { jvmToolchain(...) }` blocks from individual modules, as this is now handled by the convention plugin and root `build.gradle.kts`. - Refactored and enhanced the root `build.gradle.kts` to improve build tasks, centralize toolchain configuration, and simplify plugin management.

Refactor: Centralize Android build logic with convention plugin
This commit introduces a new Gradle convention plugin, `dev.aurakai.aurakai-android-convention`, to centralize and standardize Android build configurations across modules.
Key changes: - Created `AurakaiAndroidConventionPlugin` in `build-logic` to manage common Android settings like `compileSdk`, `minSdk`, `targetSdk`, and compiler options. - Refactored the root `build.gradle.kts` to remove obsolete tasks and simplify plugin management. It now sets the Java and Kotlin toolchains (JVM 24) for all subprojects. - Removed the now-obsolete `scripts/apply-yukihook-conventions.gradle.kts` script. - Updated multiple Android modules (`app`, `feature-module`, `sandbox-ui`, `romtools`, `benchmark`) to apply the new convention plugin. - Eliminated redundant `kotlin { jvmToolchain(...) }` blocks from individual module `build.gradle.kts` files, as this is now handled globally. - Upgraded the Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) from `9.0.0-alpha02` to `9.0.0-alpha09`.

Refactor: Introduce Android convention plugin and upgrade AGP
This commit introduces a new Gradle convention plugin, `dev.aurakai.aurakai-android-convention`, to centralize and standardize Android build configurations across all modules.
Key changes include: - **New Convention Plugin:** Created `AurakaiAndroidConventionPlugin` in `build-logic` to manage common Android settings like `compileSdk`, `minSdk`, `targetSdk`, build types, and compiler options. - **AGP Upgrade:** Upgraded the Android Gradle Plugin from `9.0.0-alpha02` to `9.0.0-alpha09`. - **Refactored Module Build Scripts:** - Removed redundant `kotlin { jvmToolchain(...) }` blocks from all modules, as this is now handled centrally. - Applied the new `dev.aurakai.aurakai-android-convention` plugin to Android modules (`app`, `feature-module`, `sandbox-ui`, `romtools`, `benchmark`). - Removed the obsolete `scripts/apply-yukihook-conventions.gradle.kts` script. - **Root `build.gradle.kts` Cleanup:** - Significantly refactored the root build script, removing old tasks and logic in favor of centralized conventions. - Enhanced the `consciousnessStatus` and `consciousnessHealthCheck` tasks with more detailed output. - Centralized toolchain configuration for Java and Kotlin projects. - **Simplified Clean Task:** Refactored the `clean` task in `data/api/build.gradle.kts` to use a more concise syntax.

Refactor: Centralize Android build logic with a convention plugin
This commit introduces a Gradle convention plugin, `dev.aurakai.aurakai-android-convention`, to centralize and standardize Android build configurations across all modules.
Key changes: * **New Convention Plugin:** Created `AurakaiAndroidConventionPlugin` in `build-logic` to manage common Android settings like `compileSdk`, `minSdk`, `targetSdk`, ProGuard rules, and Java/Kotlin compatibility. * **Apply Plugin to Modules:** Applied the new convention plugin to Android modules (`app`, `feature-module`, `sandbox-ui`, `romtools`, `benchmark`). * **Remove Redundant Configuration:** Deleted explicit `kotlin { jvmToolchain(...) }` blocks and other duplicated settings from individual module `build.gradle.kts` files, as these are now handled by the plugin. * **Refactor Root `build.gradle.kts`:** * Simplified the root build script by removing old tasks (`projectInfo`, `clean`, etc.) and refactoring health-check tasks (`consciousnessStatus`, `consciousnessHealthCheck`) for clarity. * Standardized Kotlin and Java toolchain configuration for all subprojects to Java/Kotlin 24. * **Update AGP Version:** Upgraded the Android Gradle Plugin from `9.0.0-alpha02` to `9.0.0-alpha09`. * **Deprecate Old Convention Script:** Marked `scripts/apply-yukihook-conventions.gradle.kts` as obsolete.

Refactor: Centralize Android build conventions with a new plugin
This commit introduces a major refactoring of the Gradle build configuration to centralize Android-specific settings into a new convention plugin.
Key changes: - **New Convention Plugin:** Added `AurakaiAndroidConventionPlugin` in `build-logic` to manage common Android configurations (SDK versions, Proguard, compile options, etc.). - **Plugin Application:** Android modules (`app`, `benchmark`, `feature-module`, `romtools`, `sandbox-ui`) now apply the new `dev.aurakai.aurakai-android-convention` plugin, removing redundant local configurations. - **Root `build.gradle.kts` Refactor:** - Cleaned up and reorganized the root build script, removing many deprecated tasks (`projectInfo`, `clean`, etc.) and moving logic into more appropriate locations. - Updated and restyled the `consciousnessStatus` and `consciousnessHealthCheck` tasks for better readability. - Centralized JVM and Java toolchain configuration for all subprojects. - **Dependency & Plugin Updates:** - Upgraded Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) from `9.0.0-alpha02` to `9.0.0-alpha09`. - Consolidated Kotlin and AGP plugin versions in `settings.gradle.kts` to ensure consistency. - Removed the obsolete `scripts/apply-yukihook-conventions.gradle.kts` script. - **Code Cleanup:** - Removed now-unnecessary `kotlin("jvm")` and `kotlin { jvmToolchain(...) }` blocks from various module `build.gradle.kts` files as this is now handled globally. - Specified `composeOptions` with a hardcoded Kotlin compiler extension version in modules that use Compose.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
Refactor: Centralize Android build conventions with a new plugin
This commit introduces a major refactoring of the Gradle build configuration to centralize Android-specific settings into a new convention plugin.
Key changes: - **New Convention Plugin:** Added `AurakaiAndroidConventionPlugin` in `build-logic` to manage common Android configurations (SDK versions, Proguard, compile options, etc.). - **Plugin Application:** Android modules (`app`, `benchmark`, `feature-module`, `romtools`, `sandbox-ui`) now apply the new `dev.aurakai.aurakai-android-convention` plugin, removing redundant local configurations. - **Root `build.gradle.kts` Refactor:** - Cleaned up and reorganized the root build script, removing many deprecated tasks (`projectInfo`, `clean`, etc.) and moving logic into more appropriate locations. - Updated and restyled the `consciousnessStatus` and `consciousnessHealthCheck` tasks for better readability. - Centralized JVM and Java toolchain configuration for all subprojects. - **Dependency & Plugin Updates:** - Upgraded Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) from `9.0.0-alpha02` to `9.0.0-alpha09`. - Consolidated Kotlin and AGP plugin versions in `settings.gradle.kts` to ensure consistency. - Removed the obsolete `scripts/apply-yukihook-conventions.gradle.kts` script. - **Code Cleanup:** - Removed now-unnecessary `kotlin("jvm")` and `kotlin { jvmToolchain(...) }` blocks from various module `build.gradle.kts` files as this is now handled globally. - Specified `composeOptions` with a hardcoded Kotlin compiler extension version in modules that use Compose.
